item.title: Cyberattack Hits Ukraine Then Spreads Internationally
item.description: This ransomware attack, a more sophisticated assault based on a vulnerability exploited in May, hit companies across the globe.

item.title: Police Officers in Helicopter Attack Venezuela
item.description: The attack, with grenades, was a rare act of disloyalty against a government under pressure from protests and an economic collapse.

item.title: ISIS, Aided by Ex-Taliban Groups, Makes Inroads in Northern Afghanistan
item.description: An offensive in Darzab District represents a new front for the extremist group, which had not previously found success in the area.

item.title: Philippine Military Says 17 Mutilated Civilian Bodies Found in Marawi
item.description: The grisly discovery comes as troops struggle to retake the city from Islamist militants, whose numbers are believed to have dwindled to between 150 and 200 fighters.

item.title: Six Are Charged in 1989 Hillsborough Stadium Disaster in England
item.description: A former senior police officer will face manslaughter charges. The catastrophe killed 96 fans, who were crushed or trampled.

item.title: Ransomware Attack Raises Concerns Over Future Assaults
item.description: The latest strike, which affected computers from Ukraine to the United States, has intensified worries that such events will become everyday dangers.

item.title: Airstrike on ISIS Prison in Syria Kills Dozens, Activists Say
item.description: Syrian activists said the military coalition led by the United States destroyed a house that had been turned into a prison, a claim the coalition said it was investigating.

item.title: Advertising on the French Riviera: The Internet Come to Life
item.description: The Cannes Lions festival attracts big brands, the top players in technology and boldface names. Our reporter, a first-time attendee, found plenty to observe.

item.title: Philippines May Get New Law: Sing National Anthem With Spirit or Face Prison Time
Montreal Parade, Usually a Point of Pride, Raises Debate About Racism
item.description: The sight of young men of color pushing a parade float bearing white musicians in Quebec prompts accusations of systemic racial insensitivity.
